Curie Kim | PhD Student | University of Maryland

Hello, I am Curie Kim and I am currently working as a Computer Vision Researcher at Gwangju Institute of Science and Technology (GIST). I am focusing on deep learning, especially 3D computer vision and SLAM for autonomous driving and robot vision. [CV] [SoP]

Before joining GIST, I worked for 20 months as a CMOS image sensor software developer at Samsung Electronics’ Advanced Sensor Development Team. I earned my M.S. in Electrical Engineering from Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology (KAIST) in 2021 under the guidance of Jong-Hwan Kim at RIT Lab. I reciever my B.S. in Electrical Engineering from Korea University in 2019.

I also love to crossfit, freediving, hiking and camping!
